text:
This question doesn’t appear to fit anywhere here or in discourse, so here it is.
I want the ability to start computing resources in AWS/GCP/Azure, do computation, and stop the resources.
I was assuming I’d use Kubernetes, but I’m starting to think that’s not ideal. Kubernetes is quite complicated, and its purpose is to keep a system running when something fails or more load comes online. In any case you need something to bring Kubernetes cluster online in your desired configuration.
I’m starting to think that the solution is Terraform. It supports all three clouds, and its configuration seems pretty simple.
Comments?
